DOCNAME: SZEMELY ES VAGYONOROK FUGGETLEN SZAKSZERVEZETI SZOVETSEGE v. HUNGARY
TEXT: The first applicant , Személy- és ORG , is an unregistered trade union . The second applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born on DATE and lives in PERSON . He is the president of the trade union . The applicants were represented before the ORG by Mr I. Barbalics , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , Agent , ORG and Law Enforcement .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicants’ previous application ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) was declared inadmissible for non - exhaustion of domestic remedies , pursuant to LAW , on DATE . After having pursued a petition for review before ORG , the applicants renewed their complaints . On DATE LAW declared the application partly inadmissible .

On DATE Mr Csánics and CARDINAL other individuals founded the applicant trade union . On DATE ORG requested its registration . He submitted the articles of association , a list of the officers and other relevant documents .

On DATE the ORG ordered the applicants to amend the articles of association and to submit further information . On DATE the trade union modified its articles of association and submitted the new version to ORG .

In the ensuing non - contentious ( nemperes ) proceedings , on DATE ORG held deliberations in camera and decided to refuse to register the trade union , since the applicants had failed to submit all the information required and therefore their request had not met the legal requirements . ORG relied on the documents submitted by the applicants .
On DATE the applicants retained PERSON , a lawyer , to represent them before ORG . His power of attorney was attached to the case file . This mandate has never been withdrawn .
On the ORG appeal DATE which did not contain any argument concerning ORG in camera deliberations – ORG , acting as a second - instance court , upheld the first - instance decision on DATE .
The applicants lodged a petition for review with ORG .
On DATE the applicants retained another lawyer , PERSON to represent them before the review bench of ORG . Her power of attorney mandate was also attached to the case file .
On DATE ORG ordered the applicants to amend the petition .

On DATE the review bench of ORG upheld the second - instance decision . This decision was served on PERSON on DATE . The Government submitted the acknowledgement of receipt which had been stamped at the despatching ORG on DATE and the handwritten note , indicating that it contained a copy of this decision , showing its receipt DATE by the addressee . It appears that PERSON did not inform the applicants of the decision .
The decision of the review bench of ORG was handed over to the applicants , upon their request , on DATE .

“ ... ( CARDINAL ) If authorisations have been given to CARDINAL person , the party may be represented by any of them ; however , CARDINAL representative may proceed in each act of the lawsuit ; a contrary stipulation is invalid ... ”
“ ( CARDINAL ) An authorisation may concern the entirety of the lawsuit or certain individual acts in the procedure .
( CARDINAL ) An authorisation which concerns the entirety of the proceedings entitles the representative to make any and all declarations and acts concerning the case ... ”
( CARDINAL ) The restriction of an authorisation is valid only if this is evident from the mandate itself . ”

“ The termination of the authorisation flowing from withdrawal , repudiation or the death of the party shall have effect for the court from the date of its reporting , and it shall effect for the opponent from the date of its disclosure to him .
“ If the party authorised a representative to carry on the lawsuit , the judicial documents shall be served on him instead of the party ... ”
